title: Type of Design: Laundry Detergents
question_text:
The manager of a dry cleaning facility wants to compare the effectiveness of two different types of laundry detergents. The manager thinks light colors and dark colors will react differently.
Which type of design should the manager use to effectively compare the two types of detergents?

choices.text: A randomized block design with the detergents as blocks and the light and dark colors as the treatments.
A randomized block design with the light and dark colors as the blocks and the types of detergents as the treatments.
A matched pair design with the detergents being the pair.

solution:
In this case, we are imposing a treatment which makes this an experiment, and not an observational study. We can eliminate Choice 'D'.

The treatment being imposed is the type of detergent. We can eliminate Choices 'B' and 'E'.

Since the manager thinks the detergent's light and dark colors may react differently to the types of detergent, we are going to want to block the colors, which means a completely randomized design would be inappropriate. We can eliminate Choice 'A'.

Choice 'C' is our answer.
